parallel.distributed

Class DBarrier

  • java.lang.Object
    • parallel.distributed.DBarrier

  • public class DBarrier
extends java.lang.Object
    class implements a distributed barrier object across many threads living in many (remote) JVMs. The following constraint is imposed on DBarrier objects use: the barrier() method can only be called from the same thread that created this DBarrier object (otherwise an exception is thrown).

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011

    Company:

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ioannis T. Christou

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private DActiveMsgPassingCoordinatorLongLivedConnClt _coordclt 
      private java.lang.String _coordname 
      private java.lang.String _host 
      private java.lang.Thread _originatingThread 
      private int _port 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DBarrier()
      no-arg constructor assumes the following defaults: host="localhost" port=7896 barrier/coord name = "DBarrierCoord_localhost_7896" .
      DBarrier(java.lang.String host, int port, java.lang.String coordname)
      constructor adds current thread to the barrier object of the server found in IP address specified by first two argument parameters with the name specified in the third parameter, so that later invocations of the barrier() method of this object will synchronize the current thread with all other threads in all JVMs having constructed DBarrier objects connected to the same server-port, and same barrier name.

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      the main class method.
      void removeCurrentThread()
      removes the current thread from this DBarrier object, and closes the connection.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DBarrier

        public DBarrier()
         throws java.net.UnknownHostException,
                java.io.IOException,
                java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                ParallelException
        no-arg constructor assumes the following defaults:
        • host="localhost"
        • port=7896
        • barrier/coord name = "DBarrierCoord_localhost_7896"
        . The constructor will actually register the current thread with the barrier object of the server, so later invocations of the barrier() method of this object will synchronize the current thread with all other threads in all JVMs having constructed DBarrier objects connected to the default server, default port, and default barrier name.
        Throws:
        java.net.UnknownHostException
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        ParallelException

      • DBarrier

        public DBarrier(java.lang.String host,
                int port,
                java.lang.String coordname)
         throws java.net.UnknownHostException,
                java.io.IOException,
                java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                ParallelException
        constructor adds current thread to the barrier object of the server found in IP address specified by first two argument parameters with the name specified in the third parameter, so that later invocations of the barrier() method of this object will synchronize the current thread with all other threads in all JVMs having constructed DBarrier objects connected to the same server-port, and same barrier name.
        Parameters:
        host - String
        port - int
        coordname - String
        Throws:
        java.net.UnknownHostException
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        ParallelException

    • Method Detail

      • barrier

        public void barrier()
             throws java.io.IOException,
                    java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                    ParallelException
        the main class method. Blocks until all other threads (from same and/or remote JVMs) that have registered with the same coordname as this one (in object construction time) at the same host/port address, have also called this method (on their respective DBarrier objects). The method can be called multiple times, even after some other threads in same or remote JVM have called removeCurrentThread().
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if a network error occurs
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if the server JVM is not in synch with this JVM's classes.
        ParallelException - if this DBarrier object was constructed by a different thread than the one calling this method.

      • removeCurrentThread

        public void removeCurrentThread()
                         throws java.io.IOException,
                                java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                                ParallelException
        removes the current thread from this DBarrier object, and closes the connection.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        ParallelException - if calling thread is not the same as creation thread.
